rows.text: ||Andy Rouse, Peter Lovett, Jeff Allam, Neil McGrath, Pete Hall, Dennis Leech, Graham Scarborough, Tim Harvey||Championship winner, 1983 (later DQ on technicality); Championship winner (Rouse), 1984
||John Goss, Armin Hahne, Tom Walkinshaw, Win Percy||Winner and third place
||Martin Brundle, Hans Meyer, Mike Thackwell, Jean-Louis Schlesser||7th in Manufacturer's Championship
||Derek Warwick, Eddie Cheever, Jean-Louis Schlesser, Gianfranco Brancatelli, Brian Redman, Armin Hahne, Hans Heyer, Jan Lammers||3rd in Manufacturer's Championship; DNF at Le Mans

||Martin Brundle, John Watson, Jan Lammers, Eddie Cheever, Raul Boessel, Armin Hahne, John Nielsen, Win Percy, Johnny Dumfries||WSCC championship winner (Boessel); also top 4 drivers (Raul Boessel, Jan Lammers, John Watson, Eddie Cheever); WSCC Manufacturer's winner; 5th at Le Mans

||Martin Brundle, John Nielsen, John Watson, Andy Wallace, Jan Lammers, Johnny Dumfries, Eddie Cheever, Raul Boesel, Henri Pescalaro, Danny Sulllivan, Price Cobb, Derek Daly, Kevin Cogan, Larry Perkins||WSCC championships winner (Brundle); WSCC Manufacturer's winner; Winner: 24-hours Le Mans (Lammers, Wallace, Dumfries)

||Eddie Cheever, Johnny Dumfries, John Watson, Martin Brundle, Raul Boesel, John Nielsen, Jan Lammers, Davy Jones, Danny Sullivan, ||2nd in Driver's championship (Nielsen); 3rd in Manufacturer's Championship Winner: 24-hours Daytona (Brundle, Boesel, Nielsen)

||Jan Lammers, Patrick Tambay, Andy Wallace, Alain Ferte, John Nielsen, Davy Jones, Price Cobb, Andrew Gilbert-Scott, Derek Daly, Jeff Kline, Michel Ferte, Eliseo Salazar||NOTE: transition year from V12 to V6 turbo 8th in Driver's championship (Tambay); 4th in team championship

||Derek Daly, Martin Donnelly, Patrick Tambay, Jan Lammers, Davy Jones, Raul Boesel, Price Cobb, John Nielsen, Andy Wallace||NOTE: transition year from V12 to V6 turbo 3rd (Cobb) and 4th (Nielsen) in Driver's Championship. 2nd in Manufacturer's Championship

||Martin Brundle, Alain Ferte, Jan Lammers, Andy Wallace, David Leslie, Franz Konrad, John Nielsen, Price Cobb, Eliseo Salazar, Davy Jones, Michel Ferte, Luis Pérez-Sala||NOTE: XJR-12 used for early part of season and Le Mans Winner: 24-hours Le Mans (Brundle, A Ferte, Leslie) in XJR-12; 2nd in team championship; 4th in Driver's championship (Wallace)

||Martin Brundle, Price Cobb, John Nielsen, Davy Jones, Jan Lammers, Andy Wallace, Alain Ferte||2nd in Manufacturer's championship; 3rd (Jones) and 5th (Nielsen) in Driver's Championship; Winner: 24-hours Daytona (Brundle, Boesel, Nielsen)

||Derek Warwick, Martin Brundle, Teo Farbi, John Nielsen, Bob Wollek, Kenny Acheson, Davy Jones, Raul Boesel, Michel Ferte, David Leslie, Mauro Martini, Jeff Krosnoff||NOTE: XJR-12 used solely for Le Mans Winner: Manufacturer's Championship; Winner, Driver's Championship (Farbe); 2nd, 3rd, 4th at Le Mans 24 hours

||Martin Brundle, John Nielsen, Eddie Cheever, Kenny Acheson, Davy Jones, Scott Pruett, Derek Warwick, Raul Boesel||NOTE: XJR-12 used solely for 24 hours Daytona 2nd in 24 hours Daytona; 3rd in Driver's Championship (Jones); 2nd in Manufacturer's Championship

||Derek Warwick, David Brabham, Davy Jones, Juan Manuel Fangio, Armin Hahne, Bob Wollek, Tiff Needell, Jim Richards, Matsuaki Sanada, Cor Euser, David Leslie, Andy Evans, Yojiro Terada, Ian Flux, Matt Aitken, John Watson||Jaguar Intercontinental Challenge (1 make series): Winner, Armin Hahne

||Davy Jones, David Brabham, Scott Pruett, Scott Goodyear||NOTE: XJR-12 used solely for 24 hours Daytona 2nd in 24 hours Daytona; 2nd in Driver's Championship (Jones); 3rd in Manufacturer's Championship
||Maurizio Sandro Sala, Johnny Herbert, Alex Caffi, Volker Weidler||3rd in Manufacturer's Championship; 4th in Le Mans 24 hours, 8th in Driver's Championship (Sala)
||Davy Jones, David Brabham, Scott Pruett, Scott Goodyear, John Nielsen, John Adretti||ENTRY IN 24 HOURS DAYTONA ONLY Result: 10th

||David Brabham, Andreas Fuchs, Armin Hahne, Jay Cochrane, Win Percy, David Leslie, John Nielsen, Paul Belmondo, David Coulthard||Winner, GT Class (Nielsen, Coulthard, Brabham). Subsequently disqualified due to procedural error relating to catalytic converters

||Aguri Suzuki, Kazuyoshi Hoshino, Masahiko Kageyama, John Nielsen, Michale Krumm, Franck Lagorce, Jan Lammers, Erik Comas, Andreas Montermini, Satoshi Motoyama, Takuya Kurosawa, Masami Kageyama||3rd, 5th, 6th, 10th
